page.title: 18PROJECT HQ. - HEDINGHAM
page.content: In March 1983, a committee was formed with the intention of raising funds to build a Group Headquarters for the Scouts, Guides, Brownies and Cubs in the area. A local farmer leased them a plot of land on the outskirts of the village. This included a derelict cart lodge which has been renovated and is now being used for storage. A total of Â£7,500 has been raised so far, the concrete base has been laid for the new meeting hall, and all the drainage work has been done. It is estimated that a further Â£5,000 will be needed to complete the project. The committee try to organise a fund-raising event each month. The site work is done by men through the Manpower Services Commission. Over 100 children will ultimately benefit from this community project.
